Posts.Content:
The genetic testing for breast cancer is one that looks for the BRCA gene. If one was positive for this gene, then there is an approximate 85% chance of developing either breast or ovarian cancer. Some people will then opt to prophylactically choose to have breasts and ovaries surgically removed in order to prevent cancer in these organs/structures. 
This is controversial and often health insurance doesn’t pay for either the testing or the preventative surgery. 
I’m sorry I can’t help with any places to try for testing.
Diagnosed with MS July 2006, Breast cancer 2017
I have no lesions on my soul and so I live with no limits.
Posts.Title: Cancer runs in family. Should I get genetic testing?

Posts.Content:
It’s controversial because it isn’t an actual diagnosis. You might NOT develop cancer despite being at a higher risk. If you test positive and decide you want to prophylactically have your breast and ovaries removed, often insirance won’t pay. At the time of surgery you don’t have cancer. It’s silly but that’s often how insirance works.
This test runs about
 $300 in the United States.
Diagnosed with MS July 2006, Breast cancer 2017
I have no lesions on my soul and so I live with no limits.
Posts.Title: Cancer runs in family. Should I get genetic testing?

Posts.Content:
So this means that the tissue appears irregular but there is no mass. So the bottom line is, it could be irregular due to a cancer, or it could be irregular for a whole host of other reasons. Scar tissue, fibroid tissue, poor image quality can all cause architectural distortion. It would be absolutely expected to be concerned and stressed. Try not to worry until you have something real to worry about
. I know this sounds lame. Take good care of each other and do your best until you know one way or the other. 
Best of luck you you. I’m wishing the best for your wife.
Diagnosed with MS July 2006, Breast cancer 2017
I have no lesions on my soul and so I live with no limits.
Posts.Title: Architectural distortion

Posts.Content:
Take care of you. Your kids will be fine. Kids are so resilient. I chose not to tell mine too much. They were a couple of years older when I was diagnosed. Despite their youth, they were loving and supportive. My experience with cancer made them more empathetic. They understand the importance of family.

Posts.Title: New here. Call back and ultrasound from 3D Mammo

Posts.Content:
Lapilot,
Most likely, your friend will need rides to and from the infusion center. Along with the chemotherapy medication, she will be receiving some medications to reduce side effects. These can make you sleepy or dizzy. With that in mind, she should not be driving.
The nausea and sick that one usually experiences during chemo usually hits about
 30-48 hours after infusion and can last 3-5 days after that. It’s a rough time. She will need help and support in the form of food, house keeping, errands etc. 
I wish her the very best of luck. You are so kind in looking out for her.
Diagnosed with MS July 2006, Breast cancer 2017
I have no lesions on my soul and so I live with no limits.
Posts.Title: Driving while undergoing Chemo

Posts.Content:
Please do your best to be patient and wait. Your doctor seems to be on top of this with the upcoming MRI. As serious as breast cancer can be, it doesn’t move that fast. There is typically time to get testing done. Susie is right, don’t squeeze and cause further inflammation. Do your best to manage your anxiety. Take good care of you. Do all of those things that we all know we should; get good quality sleep, get some exercise and eat well. Do keep us posted.

Posts.Title: Called back after biopsy - invasive mamory carcinoma

Posts.Content:
Hi there. You can always ask about
 genetic testing. Genetic testing probably won’t be warranted if you have no family history of breast cancer. It is $300 or more dollars and often insurance doesn’t cover it. The diagnostic mammogram and ultrasound should be enough. Dense breast tissue just means that a regular mammogram isn’t getting a clear picture. It doesn’t mean that a mass was seen or that cancer is suspected. The diagnostic mammogram and ultrasound should get a clear image. If you are concerned about
 something being missed, you could ask for an MRI. Again, your insurance my not pay for this unless your doctor says it is warranted. Be very diligent with self breast exams. If you aren’t sure how to do this thoroughly, ask a doctor to show you. Many masses are first detected by us! We must be our own advocates.
Diagnosed with MS July 2006, Breast cancer 2017
I have no lesions on my soul and so I live with no limits.

Posts.Title: New here. Call back and ultrasound from 3D Mammo

Posts.Content:
You could ask for a copy of the radiology report. That belongs to you. They can’t say no. Try to just take this at a day at a time. You may have more waiting. The needle biopsy report is never a fast thing. It can take 10 days to two weeks. Keep us posted! 
See GP if you need more support for anxiety during this time. Hang in there.
Diagnosed with MS July 2006, Breast cancer 2017
I have no lesions on my soul and so I live with no limits.
Posts.Title: New here. Call back and ultrasound from 3D Mammo

Posts.Content:
Hi there. I’m just here to lend support. I understand your anxiety. Finding a lump is a very scary situation. I can tell you from experience that ultrasound makes a fairly clear image. If the radiologist said 95% that it’s benign then you are probably fine. I know that sounds lame. But try not to panic until there is something to panic about
. 
I got the opposite line. I was told 98% chance that what they saw was malignant. I didn’t panic, but I was sad, worried, scared etc. I can tell you that the worst part was the not knowing. So be kind to yourself and take good care.
Diagnosed with MS July 2006, Breast cancer 2017
I have no lesions on my soul and so I live with no limits.
